Operation 'GetListRoles' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about what role data is returned and doesn't explicitly mention the response structure. Enhanced summary to include 'paginated' for clarity. Improved description to specify what role information is returned and clarify the pagination mechanism for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Returns a list of License Manager [roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc). The response is divided in pages. The query parameter `numItems` defines the number of items in each page, and consequently the amount of pages for the whole list.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve paginated list of License Manager roles
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all available License Manager roles. The response is divided into pages, where the `numItems` query parameter defines the number of items per page. Returns role objects containing role identifiers and metadata. Requires appropriate License Manager resources for access.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about what role data is returned and doesn't explicitly mention the response structure. Enhanced summary to include 'paginated' for clarity. Improved description to specify what role information is returned and clarify the pagination mechanism for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'Createnewappkey' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary uses inconsistent terminology ('appKey' vs 'application key'). Description is too brief and doesn't explain what the returned credentials are used for or their initial state. Enhanced summary with domain-appropriate terminology. Expanded description to clarify the purpose of the generated credentials and their immediate usability.

data.current_description: Creates a new pair of `appKey` and `appToken`.
data.summary_suggestion: Generate new application key and token pair
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new application key and token pair for API authentication. Returns both the `appKey` (identifier) and `appToken` (secret) that can be used for subsequent API requests. The generated credentials are immediately active and can be used for machine-to-machine authentication.
data.reasoning: Summary uses inconsistent terminology ('appKey' vs 'application key'). Description is too brief and doesn't explain what the returned credentials are used for or their initial state. Enhanced summary with domain-appropriate terminology. Expanded description to clarify the purpose of the generated credentials and their immediate usability.

message: Operation 'Getappkeysfromaccount' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary uses inconsistent terminology ('appKeys' vs 'application keys'). Description lacks detail about what information is returned for each key. Enhanced summary with consistent terminology. Expanded description to specify the returned data structure and use cases for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Retrieves all application keys from an account.
data.summary_suggestion: List all application keys for the account
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all application keys associated with the account. Returns a collection of appKey objects containing key identifiers, creation dates, status (active/inactive), and associated metadata. Useful for auditing and managing API credentials across the account.
data.reasoning: Summary uses inconsistent terminology ('appKeys' vs 'application keys'). Description lacks detail about what information is returned for each key. Enhanced summary with consistent terminology. Expanded description to specify the returned data structure and use cases for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'GetByAccount' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary is too generic and doesn't indicate what information is returned. Description is minimal and doesn't clarify the structure of returned data. Enhanced summary to be more specific about the returned information. Expanded description to explain what store data is included and the practical use of this information.

data.current_description: Retrieves the stores of the account and their respective hosts.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve account stores and their host information
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all stores associated with the account along with their respective host URLs. Returns store objects containing store identifiers, names, and host information. This data is useful for understanding the account's store configuration and deployment hosts.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic and doesn't indicate what information is returned. Description is minimal and doesn't clarify the structure of returned data. Enhanced summary to be more specific about the returned information. Expanded description to explain what store data is included and the practical use of this information.

message: Operation 'GetAccount' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Summary is adequate and action-oriented. Description provides good context but lacks clarity about the complete response structure and what specific account data is returned. Enhanced description to explicitly mention the response schema type and clarify all categories of information returned for better AI agent understanding of the operation's scope.

data.current_description:
Retrieves information from an account, such as company and sponsor user details, stores, and appTokens.

This endpoint only accepts requests from the host list designated for that store. If you want to try this request from this portal, be sure to add it to the list. Learn how to add hosts to the list in [How to manage accounts](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-to-manage-accounts--tutorials_6285#).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves comprehensive account information including company details, sponsor user information, associated stores, and application tokens. Returns an AccountResponse object containing account metadata, license information, and configuration details. Note: This endpoint only accepts requests from hosts designated in the account's host list. Requires appropriate License Manager resources for access.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate and action-oriented. Description provides good context but lacks clarity about the complete response structure and what specific account data is returned. Enhanced description to explicitly mention the response schema type and clarify all categories of information returned for better AI agent understanding of the operation's scope.

message: Operation 'GetUser' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about what data is returned and doesn't mention the user object structure. Added specific output details and permission context for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Allows you to get a user from the database, using the `userId` as the identifier.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve user details by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific user's information from the License Manager database using their unique `userId` identifier. Returns the user object containing profile details including email, name, and user ID. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Remove user, Save user, or Find user by email resources).
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about what data is returned and doesn't mention the user object structure. Added specific output details and permission context for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'delete_/api/license-manager/users/{userId}' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects, missing_output_details. Original summary is too vague. Description lacks critical information about permanence, side effects, and response format. Added details about data deletion, response code, and irreversibility to help AI agents understand the destructive nature of this operation.

data.current_description: Allows you to delete a user from the database, using the `userId` as the identifier.
data.summary_suggestion: Remove user from License Manager
data.description_suggestion: Permanently removes a user from the License Manager database using their `userId` identifier. This operation deletes all user records and associated data. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. Requires Save user or Remove user License Manager resources. This action cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too vague. Description lacks critical information about permanence, side effects, and response format. Added details about data deletion, response code, and irreversibility to help AI agents understand the destructive nature of this operation.

message: Operation 'GetListUsers' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary lacks pagination context. Description doesn't specify the response schema or required permissions. Added pagination clarity, response object reference, and permission requirements for better AI agent understanding of pagination handling.

data.current_description: Returns a list of registered users. The response is divided in pages. The query parameter `numItems` defines the number of items in each page, and consequently the amount of pages for the whole list.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve paginated list of all users
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all registered users in the License Manager. The response is divided into pages controlled by the `numItems` query parameter, which specifies the number of user records per page. Returns a ListUsersResponse object containing user items and paging information. Requires the 'Get paged users' License Manager resource.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks pagination context. Description doesn't specify the response schema or required permissions. Added pagination clarity, response object reference, and permission requirements for better AI agent understanding of pagination handling.

message: Operation 'GetRolesbyUser' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is vague about the retrieval action. Description lacks output details and doesn't explain what role information is returned. Added clarity about return value structure, permission requirements, and use case context for AI agents.

data.current_summary: Get roles by user or appKey
data.current_description: Retrieves License Manager roles of a particular user or application key.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve assigned roles for user or appKey
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all License Manager roles assigned to a specific user or application key identified by `userId`. Returns a list of role objects containing role IDs and associated permissions. Requires the 'Find user by email' License Manager resource. Useful for verifying user permissions and access levels.
data.reasoning: Original summary is vague about the retrieval action. Description lacks output details and doesn't explain what role information is returned. Added clarity about return value structure, permission requirements, and use case context for AI agents.

message: Operation 'RemoveRolefromUser' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary uses 'Remove' which is less precise than 'Revoke' in access control context. Description buries the important 204 response behavior and idempotency note. Reorganized to highlight response behavior upfront and clarified the single-role-per-request limitation for better AI agent understanding of operation constraints.

data.current_summary: Remove role from user or appKey
data.current_description:
Allows you to remove a License Manager role from a specific user or application key. This method only allows the removal of one role per request. The role's ID must be specified on the request path, not on the request body.

> Note that a successful response returns a `204` response with an empty body. A deletion on a role or user that does not exist will also return a `204`. Thus, this method should not be used to verify the existence of a specific user or role.
data.summary_suggestion: Revoke role from user or appKey
data.description_suggestion: Revokes a single License Manager role from a specific user or application key. The role ID must be provided in the request path (not body). Returns a 204 No Content response on success. Note: Returns 204 even if the user or role does not exist, so this endpoint cannot be used to verify existence. Only one role can be removed per request. Requires the 'Save user' License Manager resource.
data.reasoning: Original summary uses 'Remove' which is less precise than 'Revoke' in access control context. Description buries the important 204 response behavior and idempotency note. Reorganized to highlight response behavior upfront and clarified the single-role-per-request limitation for better AI agent understanding of operation constraints.

message: Operation 'RemoveRolefromUser' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary uses 'Remove' which is less precise than 'Revoke' in access control context. Description buries the important 204 response behavior and idempotency note. Reorganized to highlight response behavior upfront and clarified the single-role-per-request limitation for better AI agent understanding of operation constraints.

data.current_summary: Remove role from user or appKey
data.current_description:
Allows you to remove a License Manager role from a specific user or application key. This method only allows the removal of one role per request. The role's ID must be specified on the request path, not on the request body.

> Note that a successful response returns a `204` response with an empty body. A deletion on a role or user that does not exist will also return a `204`. Thus, this method should not be used to verify the existence of a specific user or role.
data.summary_suggestion: Revoke role from user or appKey
data.description_suggestion: Revokes a single License Manager role from a specific user or application key. The role ID must be provided in the request path (not body). Returns a 204 No Content response on success. Note: Returns 204 even if the user or role does not exist, so this endpoint cannot be used to verify existence. Only one role can be removed per request. Requires the 'Save user' License Manager resource.
data.reasoning: Original summary uses 'Remove' which is less precise than 'Revoke' in access control context. Description buries the important 204 response behavior and idempotency note. Reorganized to highlight response behavior upfront and clarified the single-role-per-request limitation for better AI agent understanding of operation constraints.

data.current_description:

Note: This endpoint only accepts requests from hosts designated in the account's host list. Requires appropriate License Manager resources for access.
